newsitem.title: TURKEY: Car bomb explodes in Turkey, two wounded.
newsitem.headline: Car bomb explodes in Turkey, two wounded.

text.p: Two people were wounded when a car bomb exploded behind government offices in northern Turkey overnight, Anatolian news agency said on Thursday.
The provincial governor said in a statement that an "illegal terror group" was responsible for the attack in the town of Tokat, Anatolian reported.
The explosion, at around 11 pm (1900 gmt) on Wednesday, injured two passers-by, smashed windows and damaged surrounding vehicles.
Guerrillas from the far-left Revolutionary People's Liberation Party-Front (DHKP-C) have been active in Tokat province in recent months.
